etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in Returne Knight of Poste from Hell. From eutopia + -an

definitions: Designating a eutopia; of, relating to, or proposing a eutopia.

notes.text: For the word's semantic relationship with utopian, see note at eutopia.

definitions: Originally: a person who inhabits a eutopia. Later chiefly: a person who imagines or proposes a eutopia.
